text: Quantity of vinegar used, type of container used, if the samples are a single piece of material or several pieces that add to the total weight of each sample. All the samples are natural.

Let the samples rest and dry during the final meal.

To replicate the procedure, you would need 4 more new and clean containers and 4 more samples identical to those used in the procedure. You would also need to know how much vinegar was thrown into the samples in the first procedure so that you would know how much to throw. Maybe, after the initial procedure and determining the changes in the masses of each sample, I would continue to observe how the samples change by determining the mass three times more in 30-minute intervals.

Students need to add the name of each sample, the size of each substance and the amount of vinegar to be added in each container. (The students need to include the name of each material, the size of each material and the amount of vinegar to be added to the container.)
